SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.vuzix.hardware
Class GestureSensor

java.lang.Object
  com.vuzix.hardware.GestureSensor
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.hardware.SensorEventListener
public abstract class GestureSensor
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.hardware.SensorEventListener

This class offers a simple interface for controlling the Gesture Sensor. It extends a SensorEventListener and provides some functions to better control the sensor's state.

TYPE_GESTURE

public static final int TYPE_GESTURE
A constant describing a gesture sensor type. This must be used when calling SensorManager.getDefaultSensor(int) to acquire the gesture sensor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GestureSensor

public GestureSensor(android.content.Context mContext)
Make sure to call super(); in the constructor of any abstraction of this class. Instantiating this class will turn off key event translation by default. If a user wants to generate key events the translation must be activated manually by calling #KeysEventsOn().

Parameters:
mContext - The context of the application using the Gesture Sensor.
Method Detail

register

public boolean register()
Register this sensorEventListener and turn on the sensor if it wasn't already active. This must be called before the listener will receive any sensor events.

Returns:
true if the receiver was successfully registered or was already registered, false if the registration failed.

unregister

public void unregister()
Unregister this sensorEventListener to keep it from running in the background. If there are no other active listeners for this sensor, this will turn the sensor off. This should be called whenever the parent app exits or pauses and does not want to receive sensor events in the background.

isOn

public static boolean isOn()
Indicates whether the GestureSensor is ON (true) or OFF (false).

Returns:
Returns true if the Gesture Sensor is enabled and is returning results, or false if the Gesture Sensor is disabled.

KeyEventsOn

public static final int KeyEventsOn()
Turns key event generation ON. This tells the M100's Gesture Sensor to produce key events in addition to its normal sensor events.

Returns:
Returns 1 for success, 0 for failure.

KeyEventsOff

public static final int KeyEventsOff()
Turns key event generation OFF. This stops the M100's Gesture Sensor from converting its normal sensor events into key events.

Returns:
Returns 1 for success, 0 for failure.

areKeyEventsOn

public static boolean areKeyEventsOn()
Indicates whether key event generation is ON (true) or OFF (false).

Returns:
Returns true if the Gesture Sensor is translating its sensor events into key events, false if only sensor events are being produced.

onAccuracyChanged

public final void onAccuracyChanged(android.hardware.Sensor sensor,
                                    int accuracy)
A callback from the implementation of SensorEventListener. This listens for a change in the accuracy of the sensor.

Specified by:
onAccuracyChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
Parameters:
sensor - The Sensor object whose accuracy changed.
accuracy - The accuracy value.

onSensorChanged

public final void onSensorChanged(android.hardware.SensorEvent event)
A callback from the implementation of SensorEventListener. This listens for output from the Gesture Sensor and relays it back. Callbacks are generated here and are overridden by abstractions of this class.

Specified by:
onSensorChanged in interface android.hardware.SensorEventListener
Parameters:
event - The SensorEvent that the M100's Gesture Sensor passes.

onBackSwipe

protected abstract void onBackSwipe(int speed)
Indicative of a backward swipe, meaning a swipe from the front of the head to the back of the head.

onForwardSwipe

protected abstract void onForwardSwipe(int speed)
Indicative of a forward swipe, meaning a swipe from the back of the head to the front of the head.

onUp

protected abstract void onUp(int speed)
Indicative of an upward swipe, meaning a swipe from below the head to above the head. This gesture will change depending on the orientation of the device. Left-eye mode will be inverted from right-eye mode.

onDown

protected abstract void onDown(int speed)
Indicative of a downward swipe, meaning a swipe from above the head to below the head. This gesture will change depending on the orientation of the device. Left-eye mode will be inverted from right-eye mode.

onNear

protected abstract void onNear()
Indicative of a gesture recognized as something close to the sensor.

onFar

protected abstract void onFar()
Indicative of a gesture recognized as something moving away from and far from the gesture sensor.
